nodes.bodyText: What's the motivation for that? I personally find more legible to do data(key1,data1).data(key2,data2) in my code instead

Well, that's a matter of taste. I think that it's useful for simple cases where just a few key/value pairs is used. And I'm probably not the only one. See for example JDK9+ Map.of() or com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap.of() methods.
I think that other impls are there because you can't chain Map.put statements, but I approved it anyway ;)
